result.execSummary:
The defendant Sharita Shepherd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Pay the balance of all applicable Court costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge.   To be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Dosage Probation Approved.

Defendant Sharita Shepherd in court with attorney Mary Dorothy Scholle.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  Statements made by the state, defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant sentenced to serve 1 YEAR at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, consecutive to case# 14CF4030, with release privileges for child care purposes only. 
Credit for ZERO days time served. 

COURT STAYS sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for a period of 2 years under the supervision of the Wisconsin Department of Corrections.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION (AS TO COUNT 1) - concurrent to case# 14CF4030: 
* Comply with the standard rules of probation.
* SERVE 90 DAYS "condition time" at the House of Correction with release privileges for treatment and child care purposes only - STAYED until 02-27-2015 at 12:00 PM.
* No contact with the Oshkosh B'Gosh Store or any K-Mart Stores.
* No contact with the co-actors.
* Perform 50 hours of community service.
* Complete a school or job training program to enhance ability to obtain employment.
* Seek and maintain full-time employment.
* Cooperate and participate with a mental health assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* Cooperate and participate with an AODA assessment and follow any recommended treatment.
* PAY the balance of all applicable court costs, fees, and surcharges - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
* Provide a DNA sample and PAY DNA surcharge - to be paid over a period of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

OTHER COURT ORDERS:
* Court ordered the Dosage Probation Program.
* Court ordered restitution set at ZERO.
* Court will grant a petition for expungement if defendant successfully completes probation without any violations and payment of all court fees in full.
* Probation orders in this case are concurrent to the probation orders in case# 14CF4030.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor.  
Court advised defendant that her voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.
Appeal rights given.

Defendant Sharita R Shepherd in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Catelin Ringersma appeared TELEPHONICALLY for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties not ready to proceed with sentencing today.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 02-20-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Sharita R Shepherd in court with attorney Mary D. Scholle.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case adjourned to 01-22-2015 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.

Defendant Sharita Shepherd in court with attorney Mary D Scholle.  Catelin A. Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:David Bitek-Greenfield Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kmart located at 4601 S 27th Street, Greenfield WI.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
